author: Ella Fitzgerald
title: The Greatest There Is
text: My man he sends me, I don't know how far
My man he sends me, I don't know how far
With oooh yeah, oooh yeah, and a ooh, bop-a-dah
What he's putting down, he never learned in school
What he's putting down, he never learned in school
Drive a good woman crazy, kill a fool
He's little and cute, wears a draped silk suit
Got great big bulging eyes
He's little and cute, wears a draped silk suit
Got great big bulging eyes
And he does all the things, that Tarzan only tries
Now he's built like a bomber, as a fighter he's fine
He takes off at loving like a B-29
And he flies... oh, go, go, go, - yes, oh yes, he's a whiz!
'Cause he's the greatest, he's the greatest that there is
Now he was born in the city, raised on a farm
Comes on like Superman, takes off like the atom bomb
And he's fine... wooooooh, oh, oh, he's a whiz!
'Cause I say, he's the greatest
He's the greatest
He's a character
He's the greatest, I say
Wooo, hoo, hoo, hoo, he's the greatest that there is
